info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Berks County through 1015 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harper Tavern, or near Palmyra, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Womelsdorf, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Strausstown and Centerport. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
